# discord_guild_onboarding (Resource)

Manages a Discord guild onboarding configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# SPDX-License-Identifier: MPL-2.0

# Manage guild onboarding configuration
# Note: Deleting this resource disables onboarding.
resource "discord_guild_onboarding" "example" {
  guild_id = "123456789012345678" # Replace with your guild ID
  enabled  = true

  # Mode: 0=ONBOARDING_DEFAULT, 1=ONBOARDING_ADVANCED
  mode = 0

  # Channels that members get opted into automatically
  default_channel_ids = [
    "111111111111111111", # Replace with your default channel IDs
    "222222222222222222", # Replace with your default channel IDs
  ]

  # Onboarding prompts
  prompts = [
    {
      # Type: 0=MULTIPLE_CHOICE, 1=DROPDOWN
      type          = 0
      title         = "What are you interested in?"
      single_select = false
      required      = true
      in_onboarding = true

      options = [
        {
          title       = "Gaming"
          description = "Join our gaming channels"
          channel_ids = ["333333333333333333"] # Replace with your channel IDs
          role_ids    = ["444444444444444444"]  # Replace with your role IDs
          emoji_name  = "\ud83c\udfae"
        },
        {
          title       = "Art"
          description = "Join our art channels"
          channel_ids = ["555555555555555555"] # Replace with your channel IDs
          role_ids    = ["666666666666666666"]  # Replace with your role IDs
          emoji_name  = "\ud83c\udfa8"
        },
      ]
    },
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `default_channel_ids` (Set of String) Channel IDs that members get opted into automatically.
- `enabled` (Boolean) Whether onboarding is enabled.
- `guild_id` (String) The ID of the guild. Acts as the resource ID.
- `prompts` (Attributes List) The onboarding prompts. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--prompts))

### Optional

- `mode` (Number) The onboarding mode (0 = ONBOARDING_DEFAULT, 1 = ONBOARDING_ADVANCED).

<a id="nestedatt--prompts"></a>
### Nested Schema for `prompts`

Required:

- `in_onboarding` (Boolean) Whether the prompt is present in the onboarding flow.
- `options` (Attributes List) The options for this prompt. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--prompts--options))
- `required` (Boolean) Whether the prompt is required.
- `single_select` (Boolean) Whether users are limited to selecting one option.
- `title` (String) The prompt title.
- `type` (Number) The prompt type (0 = MULTIPLE_CHOICE, 1 = DROPDOWN).

Read-Only:

- `id` (String) The prompt ID. Computed by the API.

<a id="nestedatt--prompts--options"></a>
### Nested Schema for `prompts.options`

Required:

- `title` (String) The option title.

Optional:

- `channel_ids` (Set of String) Channel IDs associated with this option.
- `description` (String) The option description.
- `emoji_animated` (Boolean) Whether the emoji is animated.
- `emoji_id` (String) The emoji ID, if using a custom emoji.
- `emoji_name` (String) The emoji name if custom, or the unicode character.
- `role_ids` (Set of String) Role IDs associated with this option.

Read-Only:

- `id` (String) The option ID. Computed by the API.
